com.asm.widget.codeedit

Class CodeStyle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.asm.widget.codeedit.CodeStyle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CodeStyleInterface, java.io.Serializable

    public class CodeStyle
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, CodeStyleInterface
    The CodeStyle is defines colors of a CodeEdit. You can inflate it from xml, by CodeStyle.parse().
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getColorValue

        public CodeStyle.ColorValue getColorValue(java.lang.String name)
        return the ColorValue. name format can be "{name}" or "{language}.{name}". In first one, if in the current language color name is exist, return getColorValue("{currentLanguage}.{name}") or if "base.{name}" exist, return that. In second one, just return it.

      • getColorValue

      • apply

        public void apply(CodeStyle other,
                  boolean force)
        Apply the other code style from {@code other. Only colors will be applied.

        In color, if force is false, each color value will be added if not exist in this or if force is true, just change the value.

      • parse

        public static CodeStyle parse(CodeStyle style,
                              android.content.Context context,
                              java.lang.String sf,
                              java.io.InputStream is)
                       throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
